element.value: 1. Start with as many leaves as there are symbols
2. Enqueue all leaf nodes into the first queue (by probability in increasing order)
3. While there is more than one node in the two queues:
1. Dequeue the two nodes with the lowest weight by examining the front of both queues
2. Create a new internal node, with the two just-removed nodes as children (either node can be
either child) and the sum of their weights as the new weight
3. Enqueue the new node into the rear of the second queue
4. The remaining node is the root node; the tree has now been generated
